parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
Apart from, without. A particle probably akin to aneu; aloof, i.e. Apart from.
A purse, money-bag. Probably remotely from ballo; a pouch.
A sack, wallet for carrying provisions. Of uncertain affinity; a wallet or leather pouch for food.
A sandal; anything bound under. From hupodeo; something bound under the feet, i.e. A shoe or sandal.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From husteros; to be later, i.e. to be inferior; generally, to fall short.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
